item.title: External Network Connectivity Issue
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Zoom Services Connectivity Issues in California

We are receiving reports of issues using Zoom Services from customers on specific networks in California. Our initial investigations point to an issue with an external network provider outside of Zoom. Connectivity to Zoom Services from other networks are not impacted at this time. All Zoom Services are operating normally. Summary: Zoom is experiencing connectivity issues for some customers in specific networks in California, with investigations pointing to an issue with an external network provider. All other services are operating normally.

Mar 5, 13:18 PST
Identified - We are receiving reports of issues using Zoom Services from customers on specific networks in California. Our initial investigations point to an issue with an external network provider outside of Zoom. Connectivity to Zoom Services from other networks are not impacted at this time. All Zoom Services are operating normally.

item.title: Issue with joining Teams Meetings from Zoom Rooms (Direct Guest Join).
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Zoom Rooms unable to join meetings

Engineers are currently investigating reports of service degradation for users unable to join teams meetings via the direct connect button on Zoom Rooms. This indicates a major outage with platform downtime, and our engineers are actively working on resolving the issue. We will provide updates as soon as possible. Summary:

Mar 4, 02:44 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating reports of service degradation where users are unable to join teams meetings via direct connect button on Zoom Rooms. Our engineers are working on this issue and we'll share updates as we have them.

item.title: Issue with recordings for Zoom Phone
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Intermittent Zoom Phone recording failures in South America and Asia Pacific

We are investigating an issue causing intermittent Zoom Phone recording failures for a subset of customers in South America and Asia Pacific. We will provide updates as we have them.

Feb 29, 17:24 PST
Identified - We have identified the issue causing intermittent Zoom Phone recording failures for a subset of customers in South America and Asia Pacific. We will continue to provide updates as we have them.

Feb 29, 16:56 PST
Investigating - We are investigating an issue causing intermittent Zoom Phone recording failures for a subset of customers in South America and Asia Pacific. We will provide updates as we have them.

item.title: São Paulo Zoom Phone Maintenance
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Maintenance at São Paulo Data Center Summary: Zoom will be performing a major maintenance at the South America (São Paulo) data center, which may cause brief disconnections and missed notifications for users. The maintenance will result in automatic registration to an alternative data center in Mexico and Central America. BYOC customers are advised to ensure proper SBC configuration for failover routing during the maintenance.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 15, 17:00 PDT  -  Mar 16, 00:00 PDT

Feb 29, 07:53 PST
Scheduled - Zoom will perform service maintenance at our South America (São Paulo) data center starting at 5PM Pacific (1:00AM GMT) on March 15th.

Zoom Phone users registered to the South America (São Paulo) data center will be automatically registered in an alternative data center Mexico and Central America (Queretaro, MX). During the maintenance window, a brief disconnection may be experienced and notifications may be missed. If you get disconnected, the system will attempt to reconnect you automatically.

If you are a BYOC (Bring Your Own Carrier) customer, please ensure that your Session Border Controller (SBC) is configured with alternate routing to Zoom’s Mexico and Central America (Queretaro, MX) data center in addition to the South America (São Paulo). During the maintenance window, connectivity to Zoom’s South America (São Paulo) data center will be blocked which will force calls from the Session Border Controller (SBC) to failover to Zoom’s Mexico and Central America (Queretaro, MX) data center. Traffic will continue to be routed through the Zoom SP: South America (São Paulo) data center once the maintenance is completed.

item.title: Osaka Zoom Phone Maintenance
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Service Maintenance at Asia Pacific Data Center

Zoom will be performing a service maintenance at the Asia Pacific (Osaka) data center, potentially causing brief disconnections and missed notifications for users registered in this region. There may be a significant impact on Zoom Phone and BYOC (Bring Your Own Carrier) customers during this maintenance.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 15, 05:00 - 11:00 PDT

Feb 29, 07:53 PST
Scheduled - Zoom will perform service maintenance at our Asia Pacific (Osaka) data center starting at 5:00AM Pacific (1:00PM GMT) on Mar 15th.

Zoom Phone users registered to the Asia Pacific (Osaka) data center will be automatically registered in an alternative data center Asia Pacific (Tokyo). During the maintenance window, a brief disconnection may be experienced and notifications may be missed. If you get disconnected, the system will attempt to reconnect you automatically.

If you are a BYOC (Bring Your Own Carrier) customer, please ensure that your Session Border Controller (SBC) is configured with alternate routing to Zoom’s Asia Pacific (Tokyo) data center in addition to the Asia Pacific (Osaka) data center. During the maintenance window, connectivity to Zoom’s Asia Pacific (Osaka) data center will be blocked which will force calls from the Session Border Controller (SBC) to failover to Zoom’s Asia Pacific (Tokyo) data center. Traffic will continue to be routed through the Zoom Asia Pacific (Osaka) data center once the maintenance is completed.

item.title: Issue with SMS delay
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Intermittent Delay in Inbound SMS Messages for Zoom Phone and Zoom Contact Center

We have identified the issue causing an intermittent delay or undelivered inbound SMS messages for Zoom Phone and Zoom Contact Center. We will continue to work with the underlying carrier and provide updates as we have them.

Feb 28, 14:00 PST
Identified - We have identified the issue causing an intermittent delay or undelivered inbound SMS messages for Zoom Phone and Zoom Contact Center. We will continue to work with the underlying carrier and provide updates as we have them.

Feb 28, 13:27 PST
Investigating - We are investigating an issue causing an intermittent delay or undelivered SMS messages for Zoom Phone and Zoom Contact Center. We will continue to work with the underlying carrier and provide updates as we have them.

item.title: DigiCert Global Root G2 Transition Maintenance Notice for hardware phones including generic devices (United States)
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Service Maintenance for Zoom Phone Certificates Summary: Zoom will be performing major service maintenance to replace certificates used by hardware phones with certificates signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority. This may result in a brief disconnection of calls and customers are requested to test their devices after the maintenance.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 19, 17:00 - 21:00 PDT

Feb 27, 13:37 PST
Scheduled - Zoom will perform service maintenance in the following SIP zones to replace certificates used by hardware phone (including supported managed and generic non-Zoom-managed devices) with certificates that will be signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority. Action is requested for non-Zoom-managed "other" devices. There is no action required for supported managed devices, since it already has the DigiCert Global Root G2 pushed from Zoom.

US West (N.California, N.California 2, N.California 3, N.California 4, N.California 5, N.California 6)
US East (New York 2)

Zoom will be transitioning to certificates signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority on our infrastructure during this maintenance window, and this will be a permanent change. We will not be able to postpone the date any further.

Customers are requested to keep both DigiCert Global Root CA and DigiCert Global Root G2 installed on their generic non-zoom-managed devices as we work through this transition.

If you have not done so, install DigiCert Global Root G2 root certificate on your generic devices. You can download G2 certificate here: https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0061202

During the maintenance window, a brief disconnection of calls may be experienced while the TLS connections are being reset. Once the TLS connections are reset, the devices will attempt to use Zoom’s new certificate that is signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificates. Customers are requested to test inbound and outbound calling for generic non-Zoom-managed devices to ensure that the services are functional after the certificate updates.

item.title: DigiCert Global Root G2 Transition Maintenance Notice for hardware phones including generic devices (Europe)
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Service Maintenance for Zoom Infrastructure in Europe

During the scheduled maintenance window, Zoom will be transitioning to certificates signed by Digicert Global Root G2 certificate authority, which may result in a brief disconnection of calls. It is crucial for customers to ensure the functionality of their generic non-Zoom-managed devices after the certificate updates. A permanent change is being made to the infrastructure, and users are requested to install the necessary G2 certificate if they haven't already.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Apr 19, 09:00 - 11:00 PDT

Feb 27, 13:16 PST
Scheduled - Zoom will perform service maintenance in the following SIP zones to replace certificates used by hardware phone (including supported managed and generic non-Zoom-managed devices) with certificates that will be signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority. Action is requested for non-Zoom-managed "other" devices. There is no action required for supported managed devices, since it already has the DigiCert Global Root G2 pushed from Zoom.

Europe (Amsterdam)

Zoom will be transitioning to certificates signed by Digicert Global Root G2 certificate authority on our infrastructure during this maintenance window, and this will be a permanent change. We will not be able to postpone the date any further.

Customers are requested to keep both DigiCert Global Root CA and DigiCert Global Root G2 installed on their generic non-Zoom-managed devices as we work through this transition.

If you have not done so, install DigiCert Global Root G2 root certificate on your generic devices. You can download G2 certificate here: https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0061202

During the maintenance window, a brief disconnection of calls may be experienced while the TLS connections are being reset. Once the TLS connections are reset, the devices will attempt to use Zoom’s new certificate that is signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificates. Customers are requested to test inbound and outbound calling for generic non-Zoom-managed devices to ensure that the services are functional after the certificate updates.

item.title: DigiCert Global Root G2 Transition Maintenance Notice for Zoom Conference Room Connector
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Zoom Service Maintenance for CRC SIP TLS Certificate Replacement

Zoom will be performing service maintenance on Zoom CRC to replace the SIP TLS certificate with a new certificate that is signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority for certain CRC SIP URI domains. There is no expected downtime for this change.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 1, 22:00 - 23:00 PST

Feb 27, 12:00 PST
Scheduled - Zoom will perform service maintenance on Zoom CRC to replace the SIP TLS certificate with a new certificate that is signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority for certain CRC SIP URI domains, listed below. There is no expected downtime for this change. For more information, see: https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0061202

* zoomcrc.com (US, Global)
* ny.zmus.us (US East)
* sc.zmus.us (US West)
* tw.zoomcrc.com (Taiwan)

Customers impacted: Any customer using Zoom CRC services to join Zoom meetings using the listed SIP URI domains and SIP TLS as the connection protocol. For more information, see: https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0061202

item.title: Issues with Zoom web pages
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Investigation into Zoom Web Pages Issues

We are currently investigating the issues with Zoom web pages, indicating a major outage resulting in platform downtime.

Feb 25, 21:03 PST
Investigating - We are investigating the issues with Zoom web pages, we will provide updates as we have them.

item.title: DigiCert Global Root G2 Transition Maintenance Notice for Zoom Conference Room Connector (No operational impact)
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Scheduled Zoom Maintenance for CRC SIP URI Domains Summary: Zoom will be performing maintenance to replace the current SIP TLS certificate with a new certificate for certain CRC SIP URI domains. There is no expected downtime for this change.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 23, 22:00 - 23:00 PST

Feb 23, 12:28 PST
Scheduled - Zoom will be performing maintenance service on the Zoom CRC service to replace the current SIP TLS certificate with a new certificate that is signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority for certain CRC SIP URI domains, listed below:

* tj.zmvc.us, tj.zmcn.us (China)
* zmhk.us (Hong Kong SAR)
* zmin.us (India)
* mb.zmin.us (India, Mumbai)
* zmjp.us (Japan, Tokyo)
* os.zmjp.us (Japan, Osaka)
* sg.zmvc.us (Singapore)

There is no expected downtime for this change. For more information see: https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0061202.

item.title: Mac, Windows, Android, iOS, & Linux Client Update: 2/26/24 (No Operational Impact)
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Scheduled Update for Zoom Clients Summary: Zoom will be providing a new version of their Mac, Windows, and Linux clients, as well as performing a staggered release for iOS and Android. The update includes new features such as all-screens mode, sorting chats at the folder-level, and support for automatically moving participants to/from the waiting room when the host leaves/returns. No operational impact is expected during the scheduled update.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 26, 00:00 - 05:00 PST

Feb 23, 11:33 PST
Scheduled - We will be providing a new version of our Mac, Windows, and Linux clients. They will be available for download at https://zoom.us/download. We will also be performing a staggered release for iOS and Android on applicable app stores. This update will include all-screens mode, sorting chats at the folder-level, and support for automatically moving participants to/from the waiting room when the host leaves/returns.

Windows - https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0068823
Mac - https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0068891
Linux - https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0068973
Android - https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0069088
iOS - https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0069041

There is no operational impact. All services will be available during this scheduled update.

item.title: Web Backend Update: 2/24/2024 (No Operational Impact)
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Routine Maintenance on Web Backend

We will be performing routine maintenance on our Web Backend. Please refer to the provided link for more details. This update includes the web setting for AI Companion Meeting Summary emails. There is no operational impact. All services will be available during this scheduled update. Summary: No major impact expected as routine maintenance is being performed.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 24, 17:00 - 23:00 PST

Feb 23, 11:39 PST
Scheduled - We will be performing routine maintenance on our Web Backend. Please refer to https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204758419 for more details. This update includes the web setting for AI Companion Meeting Summary emails.

There is no operational impact. All services will be available during this scheduled update.

item.title: Scheduled Zoom Software Quarterly Lifecycle Update (5/4/2024)
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - New Minimum Version Enforcement for Zoom Clients and Plugins

Summary: Zoom will be enforcing a new minimum version of all Zoom clients and plugins on May 4, 2023. Users are advised to ensure their devices are updated to the latest version. Specific versions and more information can be found in the support articles provided.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT May 4, 17:00 - 18:00 PDT

Feb 1, 10:30 PST
Scheduled - Zoom will be enforcing a new minimum version of all our Zoom clients and plugins, roughly 90 days from now on May 4, 2023. This affects the following products:
- Zoom client for meetings (Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, Android, Blackberry, and Intune)
- Zoom Rooms (including Zoom Room Controllers and companion whiteboards)
- Zoom Phone Appliances
- VDI Client and Plugin
- Virtual Room Connector
- Meetings Connector
- Recording Connector
- Meetings SDK (Native and Web)
- Video SDK (Native and Web)
- Zoom Contact Center SDK (Native)
- Zoom Node (including Meeting Connector ZC and MMR)
- Zoom Phone Local Survivability (ZPLS) module

Please ensure your devices are updated to the latest version.

For more information, such as specific versions we are enforcing, please see the Zoom Software Quarterly Lifecycle Policy support article: https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360059429231

item.title: Users unable to join team meetings via direct connect button on Zoom Rooms.
item.content:encoded:
Feb 15, 11:30 PST
Resolved - A resolution has been identified and is currently being implemented. These issues do not affect Zoom Rooms for Windows or Mac 5.17.0 and greater; upgrading to the latest version will resolve the problem. As a workaround on versions 5.16.x and lower, users can join Microsoft Teams meetings by pressing the "Microsoft Teams" button on the Zoom Rooms Controller Home Screen (if enabled) or pressing the "Join" button and selecting Microsoft Teams, then manually entering the Microsoft Teams meeting ID and passcode.

Feb 14, 20:21 PST
Monitoring - A resolution has been identified and is currently being implemented. These issues do not affect Zoom Rooms for Windows or Mac 5.17.0 and greater; upgrading to the latest version will resolve the problem. As a workaround on versions 5.16.x and lower, users can join Microsoft Teams meetings by pressing the "Microsoft Teams" button on the Zoom Rooms Controller Home Screen (if enabled) or pressing the "Join" button and selecting Microsoft Teams, then manually entering the Microsoft Teams meeting ID and passcode.

Feb 14, 15:03 PST
Identified - We have identified the issue where users are unable to join Microsoft Teams meetings using direct guest join (DGJ) from the meeting list of the Zoom Rooms Controller when using Zoom Rooms for Windows or Zoom Rooms for Mac versions less than 5.16.x and lower. These issues do not affect Zoom Rooms for Windows or Mac 5.17.0 and greater; upgrading to the latest version will resolve the problem. As a workaround on versions 5.16.x and lower, users can join Microsoft Teams meetings by pressing the "Microsoft Teams" button on the Zoom Rooms Controller Home Screen (if enabled) or pressing the "Join" button and selecting Microsoft Teams, then manually entering the Microsoft Teams meeting ID and passcode. Our engineers are currently working with our partners to resolve this issue. We will continue to provide updates as we have them.

Feb 14, 11:42 PST
Update - We continue to investigate an issue where users are unable to join Microsoft Teams meetings using direct guest join (DGJ) from the meeting list of the Zoom Rooms Controller when using Zoom Rooms for Windows or Zoom Rooms for Mac versions less than 5.16.x and lower. These issues do not affect Zoom Rooms for Windows or Mac 5.17.0 and greater; upgrading to the latest version will resolve the problem. As a workaround on versions 5.16.x and lower, users can join Microsoft Teams meetings by pressing the "Microsoft Teams" button on the Zoom Rooms Controller Home Screen (if enabled) or pressing the "Join" button and selecting Microsoft Teams, then manually entering the Microsoft Teams meeting ID and passcode. Our engineers are currently investigating the impact and root cause & will share updates as they’re available.

Feb 14, 08:42 PST
Update - We continue to investigate an issue where users are unable to join Microsoft Teams meetings using direct guest join (DGJ) from the meeting list of the Zoom Rooms Controller when using Zoom Rooms for Windows or Zoom Rooms for Mac versions less than 5.16.x and lower. These issues do not affect Zoom Rooms for Windows or Mac 5.17.0 and greater; upgrading to the latest version will resolve the problem. As a workaround on versions 5.16.x and lower, users can join Microsoft Teams meetings by pressing the "Microsoft Teams" button on the Zoom Rooms Controller Home Screen (if enabled) or pressing the "Join" button and selecting Microsoft Teams, then manually entering the Microsoft Teams meeting ID and passcode. Our engineers are currently investigating the impact and root cause & will share updates as they’re available.

Feb 14, 07:43 PST
Update - We continue to investigate this issue where users are unable to join teams meetings via direct guest join(DGJ) button on Zoom Rooms. Our engineers are currently investigating the impact and root cause & will share updates as they’re available. Meanwhile, you will be able to join the call by manually entering the meeting ID, or by upgrading to the latest ZR version available on zoom.us/download.

Feb 14, 06:42 PST
Update - We continue to investigate this issue where users are unable to join teams meetings via direct guest join(DGJ) button on Zoom Rooms. Our engineers are currently investigating the impact and root cause & will share updates as they’re available. Meanwhile, you will be able to join the call by manually entering the meeting ID, or by upgrading to the latest ZR version available on zoom.us/download.

Feb 14, 05:42 PST
Investigating - We are currently investigating reports of service degradation where users are unable to join teams meetings via the direct guest join (DGJ) button on Zoom Rooms ( V: 5.15.X.X) Our engineers are currently investigating the impact and root cause & will share updates as they’re available. Meanwhile, you will be able to join the call manually by adding the link on your browser, or by upgrading the ZR version.

item.title: Scheduled Zoom Software Quarterly Lifecycle Update (2/3/2024)
item.content:encoded:
Feb 3, 18:00 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Feb 3, 17:00 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jan 3, 10:46 PST
Update - As a reminder roughly 30 days ahead of the upcoming enforcement, Zoom will be enforcing a new global minimum version for all our Zoom clients and plugins this February 3rd. This affects the following products:
- Zoom client for meetings (Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, Android, Blackberry, and Intune)
- Zoom Rooms and Controllers
- Zoom Phone Appliances
- VDI Client and Plugin
- Virtual Room Connector
- Meetings Connector
- Recording Connector
- Meeting SDK (native and web)
- Video SDK (native and web)

For more information, such as specific versions we are enforcing, refer to the Zoom Software Quarterly Lifecycle Policy support article: https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360059429231

To assist with checking the client versions on your account, refer to the Dashboard support article: https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360039656511#h_13ce9a73-91e5-4df6-9cb5-c815b1605cf5

Nov 1, 10:41 PDT
Scheduled - Zoom will be enforcing a new minimum version of all our Zoom clients and plugins, roughly 90 days from now on February 3, 2023. This affects the following products:
- Zoom client for meetings (Windows, macOS, Linux, iOS, Android, Blackberry, and Intune)
- Zoom Rooms (including Zoom Room Controllers and companion whiteboards)
- Zoom Phone Appliances
- VDI Client and Plugin
- Virtual Room Connector
- Meetings Connector
- Recording Connector
- Meetings SDK (Native and Web)
- Video SDK (Native and Web)
- Zoom Contact Center SDK (Native)
- Zoom Node
- Zoom Phone Local Survivability (ZPLS) module

Please ensure your devices are updated to the latest version.

For more information, such as specific versions we are enforcing, please see the Zoom Software Quarterly Lifecycle Policy support article: https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360059429231

To assist with checking the client versions on your account, refer to the Dashboard support article for more information: https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360039656511#h_13ce9a73-91e5-4df6-9cb5-c815b1605cf5

item.title: Updated Malaysia Toll Numbers
item.content:encoded:
Jan 26, 00:00 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jan 18, 09:47 PST
Scheduled - Due to a change with our phone carrier, the below Malaysia Toll numbers are being decommissioned.

+60 3 XXXX 2229
+60 3 XXXX 1727

Your accounts will still have the following two Malaysia Toll numbers available for use:

+60 3 XXXX 4079
+60 3 XXXX 4080

Please make sure to make any necessary updates in your Admin Portal (https://zoom.us/account/setting?tab=telephony) to ensure availability for use of the remaining 2 Malaysia numbers on your account. Only if you are not already using the remaining numbers noted above, currently scheduled meetings for 02/29/2024 and onward may need to be rescheduled so that the updated toll numbers will be reflected in newly scheduled meetings. If meeting invites are not updated to reflect the additional toll numbers, participants dialing in from Malaysia will not be able to join using the decommissioned number after 2/29/2024. Any newly created meetings scheduled after you’ve updated the numbers in your portal will be automatically updated with the remaining Malaysia toll number(s) for future invites.

To view your current and new numbers in order to make the above changes, please visit your Admin Portal. There you will be able to find all Malaysia numbers that will remain supported.

item.title: DigiCert Global Root G2 Transition Maintenance Notice for BYOC Customers (EMEA, US)
item.content:encoded:
Jan 19, 19:02 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jan 19, 17:00 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Dec 19, 11:51 PST
Scheduled - Zoom will perform service maintenance in the following sip zones to replace BYOC/BYOP (Bring Your Own Carrier/Bring Your Own PBX) with certificates that will be signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority:

Europe (Amsterdam)
US Central (Colorado)
US East (New York)

Zoom had previously notified about these certificate changes as outlined here, but we rolled back the certificates on our infrastructure to DigiCert Global Root CA. Zoom is currently still utilizing DigiCert Global Root CA in above sip zones:
https://status.zoom.us/incidents/dmms8h3zvv6z
https://status.zoom.us/incidents/b6pgx3y0mlg2

Zoom will be transitioning to certificates signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority on our infrastructure during this new maintenance window and this will be a permanent change. We will not be able to postpone the date any further. Customers are requested to keep both DigiCert Global Root CA and DigiCert Global Root G2 installed on their SBCs as we work through this transition.

If you have not done so please install DigiCert Global Root G2 root certificate on your BYOC-Premises Session Border Controller (SBC). You can download G2 certificate here: https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0061202

During the maintenance window, a brief disconnection of calls may be experienced while the TLS connections are being reset. Once the TLS connections are reset, the devices will attempt to use Zoom’s new certificate that is signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificates. Customers are requested to test inbound and outbound calling using BYOC-P SBCs and generic devices to ensure that the services are functional after the certificate updates.

item.title: DigiCert Global Root G2 Transition Maintenance Notice for BYOC Customers (APAC)
item.content:encoded:
Jan 19, 11:00 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jan 19, 09:01 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Dec 19, 11:47 PST
Scheduled - Zoom will perform service maintenance in the following sip zones to replace BYOC/BYOP (Bring Your Own Carrier/Bring Your Own PBX) with certificates that will be signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority:

Asia Pacific (Tokyo)

Zoom had previously notified about these certificate changes as outlined here, but we rolled back the certificates on our infrastructure to DigiCert Global Root CA. Zoom is currently still utilizing Digicert Global Root CA in above sip zone:
https://status.zoom.us/incidents/qyzlvh0j3d35

Zoom will be transitioning to certificates signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificate authority on our infrastructure during this new maintenance window and this will be a permanent change. We will not be able to postpone the date any further. Customers are requested to keep both DigiCert Global Root CA and DigiCert Global Root G2 installed on their SBCs as we work through this transition.

If you have not done so please install DigiCert Global Root G2 root certificate on your BYOC-Premises Session Border Controller (SBC). You can download G2 certificate here: https://support.zoom.com/hc/en/article?id=zm_kb&sysparm_article=KB0061202

During the maintenance window, a brief disconnection of calls may be experienced while the TLS connections are being reset. Once the TLS connections are reset, the devices will attempt to use Zoom’s new certificate that is signed by DigiCert Global Root G2 certificates. Customers are requested to test inbound and outbound calling using BYOC-P SBCs and generic devices to ensure that the services are functional after the certificate updates.
